intro: Hieracium psilurum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a hairy texture. Hieracium psilurum is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in some regions.
